intro: Clematis uncinata var. floribunda, commonly known as the climbing clematis, is a deciduous vine native to the eastern United States. It features compound leaves with three to five leaflets, and its flowers are typically white or pale blue, with five petals. The plant produces small, round, green fruits that mature into dry, papery capsules. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Clematis uncinata var. floribunda is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to climb trellises or walls.
